title: ISic004388. Honorific inscription for Valerius Licinius Licinianus as Caesar
body:
1V(alerio) [Li]cinio
2[---]Ḷ[icinia]no
3[nob]ịḷịṣṣịṃ[o]
4[---]Caesạ[ri]
5[res p(ublica)] Halaẹsi-
6no[ru]m devota
7numị[ni maie-]
8[s]tatique [eius]

1V[..]CINIO
2[---].[......]NO
3[...].......[.]
4[---]CAES.[..]
5[.....]HALA.SI
6NO[..]MDEVOTA
7NUM.[......]
8[.]TATIQUE[....]

Facsimile Images

Apparatus criticus

  • Text of Scibona 2017 no.23 modified by comparison with photograph ;
  • Line.1: Scibona: V. [LIC]INIO
  • Line.2: Scibona: LICINIA]NO
  • Line.3: Scibona: NOBIL]I[S]SIMO
  • Line.4: Scibona: CAESA[RI]
  • Line.5: Scibona: [RES. P.] HALAESI
  • Line.7: Scibona: NUMI[NI MAIE]

English translation

To Valerius Licinius Licinianus, most noble Caesar, the Res Publica of the people of Halaesa (set this up), vowed to his divine power and majesty

Italian translation

A Valerio Licinio Liciniano nobilissimo Cesare la Res Publica del popolo di Halaesa (dedica questa), devota al suo potere divino ed alla sua maestà

commentary

The abbreviation Res P(ublica) in line 5 is adopted as the form used on other examples from Halaesa (ISic003587 and ISic003590)

Scibona offers a clear rationale for assuming that this refers to Valerius Licinius Licinianus the younger, son of the Augustus of 308-324, and himself Caesar between 317 and his death, aged 11, in 326 CE.

ISic000026 from Palermo is a dedication to Valerius Licinianus the elder, before 314 CE.

bibliography

  • Scibona 2017 667 no.23 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002601
  • Portale 2021 76 fig. 20 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10003142
